paper_abstract: We extend the conductance and canonical paths methods to the setting of general finite Markov chains, including non-reversible non-lazy walks. The new path method is used to show that a known bound for the mixing time of a lazy walk on a Cayley graph with a symmetric generating set also applies to the non-lazy non-symmetric case, often even when there is no holding probability.
paper_title: Intersection Conductance and Canonical Alternating Paths: Methods for General Finite Markov Chains
